meanings.definition: The quality or state of being indefeasible.
meanings.sent1: The indefeasibilities of her love for animals were evident in the way she cared for every stray she found.
meanings.sent2: Legal experts discussed the indefeasibilities of property rights during the conference.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, the magician could not make the indefeasibilities of his disappearing act work.
meanings.sent4: The indefeasibilities of friendship are like invisible threads that bind us together.
meanings.sent5: The teacher emphasized the indefeasibilities of honesty to the students, urging them to always tell the truth.

meanings.definition: The property of being not subject to being annulled or voided.
meanings.sent1: The indefeasibilities of the contract ensured that it could not be canceled without consequences.
meanings.sent2: Homeowners were relieved to learn about the indefeasibilities of their property rights.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape had the indefeasibilities of granting him the power to fly.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had the indefeasibilities of brightening up even the gloomiest of days.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact possessed the indefeasibilities of bringing good luck to its owner.
